titlestmt.titleproper: Roll books and general attendance records of the Faculty of the Wagner Free Institute of Science 1893-1979
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Roll books and general attendance records of the Faculty of the Wagner Free Institute of Science

bioghist.p: Incorporated by William Wagner in 1855, the Wagner Free Institute is a natural history museum and educational institution in Philadelphia that is dedicated to providing free public education in the sciences. William Wagner originally offered free lectures and classes in his home and at Spring Garden Hall. He later constructed an Institute building, which opened to the public in 1865. The Institute's educational programming is offered onsite and at locations around Philadelphia.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of 17 volumes of roll books for the lecture series at the Wagner Free Institute of Science from 1893 to 1979. Thirteen volumes are course-specific roll books, listing names of professors and students' names, attendance, grades, and certificates received for each course. The other four volumes contain yearly statistics of the number of lectures given, number of attendees, and number of certificates awarded. In these summary volumes, course titles and names of students are sometimes pasted in.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Wagner Free Institute of Science: student files (97-002) also contains information on the Institute's student enrollment and certificates awarded. Minutes of the Faculty (89-035) includes additional information.
